data.text: @origincanada @hjelle_brian @CDCDirector Yes, researchers have known this for a long time now.
@perpetualmystik @hjelle_brian No kidding…but can you imagine? That’s still their smartest and the stupidity has yet to hit them? 😳😵‍💫😱
@origincanada @hjelle_brian Interpretation is not science. I would imagine some scientists may interpret these findings quite differently as well.

@origincanada @hjelle_brian We’ll see. “Science” has lost my confidence lately. It’s very skewed by the money behind it and what they hope to find. For example, some “scientists” say kids need a Covid vaccine. And “scientists” say healthy people should be wearing masks. But others disagree. Interpretation.

@origincanada @hjelle_brian seemingly without sequelae, we need to be careful about a finding that flies in the face of that. I'm not saying it's not real but there are so many gaps, further evidence is required to establish the validity, the clinical significance, and generalizability.

@origincanada @hjelle_brian I agree it needs to be investigated. My initial point was just that many things have been associated with brain shrinkage making the COVID association meaningless without knowing whether it resolves or results in problems. In the context of the now millions who have recovered...
@the4shuffle @hjelle_brian I would like to read the other experts that you mention as I am interested in other POVs/angles. Sincerely.
